ericStrategies.name: Access new funding
ericStrategies.definition: Access new or existing money to facilitate the implementation.

ericStrategies.name: Alter incentive/allowance structures
ericStrategies.definition: Work to incentivize the adoption and implementation of the clinical innovation.

ericStrategies.name: Assess for readiness and identify barriers and facilitators
ericStrategies.definition: Assess various aspects of an organization to determine its degree of readiness to implement, barriers that may impede implementation, and strengths that can be used in the implementation effort.

ericStrategies.name: Audit and provide feedback
ericStrategies.definition: Collect and summarize clinical performance data over a specified time period and give it to clinicians and administrators to monitor, evaluate, and modify provider behavior.

ericStrategies.name: Build a coalition
ericStrategies.definition: Recruit and cultivate relationships with partners in the implementation effort.

ericStrategies.name: Capture and share local knowledge
ericStrategies.definition: Capture local knowledge from implementation sites on how implementers and clinicians made something work in their setting and then share it with other sites.

ericStrategies.name: Centralize technical assistance
ericStrategies.definition: Develop and use a centralized system to deliver technical assistance focused on implementation issues.

ericStrategies.name: Change physical structure and equipment
ericStrategies.definition: Evaluate current configurations and adapt, as needed, the physical structure and/or equipment (e.g., changing the layout of a room, adding equipment) to best accommodate the targeted innovation.

ericStrategies.name: Change record systems
ericStrategies.definition: Change records systems to allow better assessment of implementation or clinical outcomes.

ericStrategies.name: Conduct cyclical small tests of change
ericStrategies.definition: Implement changes in a cyclical fashion using small tests of change before taking changes system-wide.

ericStrategies.name: Conduct educational meetings
ericStrategies.definition: Hold meetings targeted toward different stakeholder groups to teach them about the clinical innovation.

ericStrategies.name: Conduct educational outreach visits
ericStrategies.definition: Have a trained person meet with providers in their practice settings to educate providers about the clinical innovation with the intent of changing the provider's practice.

ericStrategies.name: Conduct ongoing training
ericStrategies.definition: Plan for and conduct training in the clinical innovation in an ongoing way.

ericStrategies.name: Create a learning collaborative
ericStrategies.definition: Facilitate the formation of groups of providers or provider organizations and foster a collaborative learning environment to improve implementation of the clinical innovation.

ericStrategies.name: Develop a formal implementation blueprint
ericStrategies.definition: Develop a formal implementation blueprint that includes all goals and strategies.

ericStrategies.name: Develop educational materials
ericStrategies.definition: Develop and format manuals, toolkits, and other supporting materials.

ericStrategies.name: Distribute educational materials
ericStrategies.definition: Distribute educational materials (including guidelines, manuals, and toolkits).

ericStrategies.name: Facilitation
ericStrategies.definition: A process of interactive problem solving and support that occurs in a context of a recognized need for improvement and a supportive interpersonal relationship.

ericStrategies.name: Identify and prepare champions
ericStrategies.definition: Identify and prepare individuals who dedicate themselves to supporting, marketing and driving through an implementation.

ericStrategies.name: Inform local opinion leaders
ericStrategies.definition: Inform providers identified by colleagues as opinion leaders or 'educationally influential' about the clinical innovation.

ericStrategies.name: Involve patients/consumers and family members
ericStrategies.definition: Engage or include patients/consumers and families in the implementation effort.

ericStrategies.name: Organize clinician implementation team meetings
ericStrategies.definition: Develop and support teams of clinicians who are implementing the innovation.

ericStrategies.name: Provide clinical supervision
ericStrategies.definition: Provide clinicians with ongoing supervision focusing on the innovation.

ericStrategies.name: Provide ongoing consultation
ericStrategies.definition: Provide ongoing consultation with one or more experts.

ericStrategies.name: Remind clinicians
ericStrategies.definition: Develop reminder systems designed to help clinicians to recall information.

ericStrategies.name: Tailor strategies
ericStrategies.definition: Tailor the implementation strategies to address barriers and leverage facilitators.

ericStrategies.name: Use train-the-trainer strategies
ericStrategies.definition: Train designated clinicians or organizations to train others in the clinical innovation.

ericStrategies.name: Visit other sites
ericStrategies.definition: Visit sites where a similar implementation effort has been considered successful.

Implementation Outcomes.name: Acceptability
Implementation Outcomes.definition: The perception among implementation stakeholders that a given treatment, service, practice, or innovation is agreeable, palatable, or satisfactory.

Implementation Outcomes.name: Adoption
Implementation Outcomes.definition: The intention, initial decision, or action to try or employ an innovation or evidence-based practice.

Implementation Outcomes.name: Appropriateness
Implementation Outcomes.definition: The perceived fit, relevance, or compatibility of the innovation or evidence based practice for a given practice setting, provider, or consumer.

Implementation Outcomes.name: Feasibility
Implementation Outcomes.definition: The extent to which a new treatment, or an innovation, can be successfully used or carried out within a given agency or setting.

Implementation Outcomes.name: Fidelity
Implementation Outcomes.definition: The degree to which an intervention was implemented as it was prescribed in the original protocol.

Implementation Outcomes.name: Implementation Cost
Implementation Outcomes.definition: The cost impact of an implementation effort.

Implementation Outcomes.name: Penetration
Implementation Outcomes.definition: The integration of a practice within a service setting and its subsystems.

Implementation Outcomes.name: Sustainability
Implementation Outcomes.definition: The extent to which a newly implemented treatment is maintained or institutionalized within a service settingâ€™s ongoing, stable operations.

Service Outcomes.name: Efficiency
Service Outcomes.definition: The extent to which a service achieves its outcomes with the minimal expenditure of resources.

Service Outcomes.name: Safety
Service Outcomes.definition: The extent to which a service minimizes the risk of harm to consumers.

Service Outcomes.name: Effectiveness
Service Outcomes.definition: The extent to which a service achieves its intended outcomes when delivered in real-world settings.

Service Outcomes.name: Equity
Service Outcomes.definition: The extent to which a service is delivered in a way that is fair and just, without disparities based on patient characteristics.

Service Outcomes.name: Patient-centeredness
Service Outcomes.definition: The extent to which a service is respectful of and responsive to individual patient preferences, needs, and values.

Service Outcomes.name: Timeliness
Service Outcomes.definition: The extent to which a service is provided to consumers in a timely manner, reducing waits and harmful delays.

Client Outcomes.name: Satisfaction
Client Outcomes.definition: The client's level of contentment with the services received.

Client Outcomes.name: Function
Client Outcomes.definition: The impact of a service on a client's ability to perform daily activities and roles.

Client Outcomes.name: Symptomatology
Client Outcomes.definition: The effect of a service on a client's symptoms and signs of illness.
